components.name: /etc
notes: Core system configuration directory, should hold only configuration files and not any binaries.

components.name: /bin
notes: Essential ready-to-run programs (binaries), includes the most basic commands such as ls and cp.

components.name: /sbin
notes: Contains essential system binaries, usually can only be ran by root.

components.name: /var
notes: Variable directory, it's used for system logging, user tracking, caches, etc. Basically anything that is subject to change all the time.
/etc/passwd save user info
/etc/group save group info

commands.name: nslookup
notes: name server look up

commands.name: lsof
notes: list open files
show you a list of all the open files and their associated process.
Appending & to the command will run the command in the background

commands.name: ps
notes: the process status command (ps) displays information about active processes

commands.name: top
notes: real time information about the processes running on your system instead of a snapshot.

issues.question: what is the TTY field in the ps outpu
answers: In a modern operating system (OS), the concept applies directly. Linux uses a device file to represent a virtual TTY, which enables interaction with the OS by handling input (usually a keyboard) and output (usually a screen).

Components.name: setuid & setgid
notes: Setuid, which stands for set user ID on execution,It is a security tool that permits users to run certain programs with escalated privileges.
When an executable file's setuid permission is set, users may execute that program with a level of access that matches the user who owns the file.

Components.name: umask
notes: the umask command returns, or sets, the value of the system's file mode creation mask.

Components.name: chmod
notes: sets the permissions of files or directories.

Components.name: chown
notes: changes ownership of files and directories in a filesystem.

Components.name: sudo
notes: superuser do
run a command with root access,

Components.name: grep
notes: a common text processing command. It allows you to search files for characters that match a certain pattern

Components.name: head tail
notes: head: see the first  lines of a file
tail: see the last lines of a file

Components.name: env
notes: outputs a whole lot of information about the environment variables you currently have set

Components.name: nc
notes: Netcat (or nc) is a command-line utility that reads and writes data across network connections, using the TCP or UDP protocols.
use Netcat to debug and monitor network connections, scan for open ports, transfer data, as a proxy, and more

Components.name: cat
notes: short for concatenate
look file content, combine multiple files to one file

Components.name: less
notes: look a large file content

Components.name: rm, rmdir
notes: delete files or directory

Components.name: find
notes: a short description of the command

Components.name: whatis
notes: search  file or directory at the specified directory

Components.name: history
notes: look the history of you had input commands
> is a redirection operator,but it will overwrite the output[maybe a file]
>> is a redirection operator, but only append to the output[maybe a file]
< is a redirection operator, but only read the input
